programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: "NBA Countdown" serves as the primer for game telecasts on the ESPN family of networks. It's highlighted by a lively roundtable discussion and debate of the top storylines around the league. Seats at the table are reserved for folks in ESPN's stable of NBA hosts and analysts, with the latter group imparting wisdom based on their many years of playing experience.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The new-look Knicks take their act on the road for a date with the 76ers. Joel Embiid continued his pursuit of a second straight MVP award by registering a triple-double in Philadelphia's last outing, a 110-97 triumph versus Chicago on Jan. 2.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Ja Morant's Grizzlies begin a three-game excursion by visiting LeBron James and the Lakers. While Morant's 2023-24 debut was a success in a road win over New Orleans, Memphis dropped the next two games away from home to Denver and the Clippers.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Gators (10-3) and the No. 6 Wildcats (10-2) fire up their SEC schedules with this contest. Kentucky is 9-1 in the last 10 meetings with Florida after winning two 2022-23 matchups by a combined 13 points. The Gators are on a six-game winning run.

programme.title: College Basketball Live Scoreboard
programme.desc: All the latest scores and highlights from college basketball.

programme.title: NFL Countdown
programme.desc: Samantha Ponder introduces the features and directs the storylines associated with the day's games, joined by a roster of analysts and reporters of ex-NFL players, coaches and executives including Tedy Bruschi, Randy Moss, Alex Smith, and Rex Ryan.

programme.title: NFL Football
programme.desc: The Ravens (13-3) tune up for a postseason run by facing a Steelers (9-7) side trying to book its spot. Baltimore clinched the top seed in the AFC and a first-round bye, but is 1-6 in its last seven against Pittsburgh, including a 17-10 Week 5 loss.

programme.title: NFL Countdown
programme.desc: Samantha Ponder introduces the features and directs the storylines associated with the day's games, joined by a roster of analysts and reporters of ex-NFL players, coaches and executives including Tedy Bruschi, Randy Moss, Alex Smith, and Rex Ryan.

programme.title: NFL Football
programme.desc: The Colts and Texans clash in a winner-gets-in matchup with division title implications. An AFC playoff spot goes to the victor, along with an opportunity to enter the wild-card round as AFC South champions if Jacksonville loses on Sunday.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: SportsCenter

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Sunday NFL Countdown
programme.desc: This Sunday pregame staple debuted in 1985 and soon became a signature ESPN series. Host Samantha Ponder introduces the features and directs the storylines associated with the day's games, joined by a roster of analysts highlighted by ex-NFL players, coaches and executives including Tedy Bruschi, Randy Moss, Matt Hasselbeck, Rex Ryan and Louis Riddick. Chris Mortensen and Adam Schefter deliver breaking news and injury updates, while reporters at game sites set the scenes.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 1 Gamecocks seek their 36th home victory in a row as the SEC foe Bulldogs visit Colonial Life Arena. South Carolina's last loss in Columbia occurred on Dec. 3, 2020, to NC State. South Carolina has won five straight versus Mississippi State.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 7 Tigers (14-1, 1-0 SEC) cross the state line for a date with the Rebels (11-3, 1-0). LSU has won 10 straight matches with Ole Miss dating back to 2016. Angel Reese notched a 36-point, 20-rebound double-double in LSU's 69-60 win last season.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 15 Tigers host the Mustangs for an American Athletic Conference contest. Memphis is 6-0 at FedExForum with David Jones averaging 22 points in those games. The Tigers have won three straight meetings, two last season by a combined 34 points.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Championship Drive
programme.desc: Led by host Kevin Connors, college football analysts and reporters meet to discuss and debate who the top teams are in the country.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee brings his humor and candor to the microphone to highlight the day's top stories.

programme.title: College Football Live
programme.desc: Want to know up-to-the-minute reports about your favorite college football team? ESPN has it covered with this weekday studio show, a roundtable format that emphasizes discussion and opinions on the sport's biggest stories and newsmakers. The half-hour program features a rotating roster of analysts that includes coaches, former players, and media personalities.

programme.title: Championship Drive
programme.desc: Led by host Kevin Connors, college football analysts and reporters meet to discuss and debate who the top teams are in the country.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: Originating from the site of one of the day's best matchups, with a sea of fans cheering wildly in the background, host Rece Davis and analysts Lee Corso, Kirk Herbstreit and Desmond Howard talk college football for three hours, reporting on the top teams, games, players and storylines. David Pollack and Maria Taylor contribute reports, interviews and features. Davis replaced longtime host Chris Fowler in 2015.

programme.title: NBA Countdown
programme.desc: "NBA Countdown" serves as the primer for game telecasts on the ESPN family of networks. It's highlighted by a lively roundtable discussion and debate of the top storylines around the league. Seats at the table are reserved for folks in ESPN's stable of NBA hosts and analysts, with the latter group imparting wisdom based on their many years of playing experience.

programme.title: NBA Courtside
programme.desc: An insight into upcoming National Basketball Association matches, highlighting the players to watch and the top team news.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: From Wells Fargo Center in Philadelphia.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: The new-look Knicks take their act on the road for a date with the 76ers. Joel Embiid continued his pursuit of a second straight MVP award by registering a triple-double in Philadelphia's last outing, a 110-97 triumph versus Chicago on Jan. 2.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NFL Matchup
programme.desc: An NFL Films production, "NFL Matchup" is definitely a show for football junkies. Unlike traditional football preview programs, this one gives fans an in-depth look at some of Sunday's games by breaking down the strategy and tactics -- the Xs and Os -- through the exclusive use of team-supplied footage. That type of film study is a forte of former NFL player and executive Louis Riddick and NFL Films producer Greg Cosell, whose work is featured here alongside host Sal Paolantonio.

programme.title: UFC Top 10
programme.desc: A look at the top 10 title fights in the UFC.

programme.title: NFL Matchup
programme.desc: An NFL Films production, "NFL Matchup" is definitely a show for football junkies. Unlike traditional football preview programs, this one gives fans an in-depth look at some of Sunday's games by breaking down the strategy and tactics -- the Xs and Os -- through the exclusive use of team-supplied footage. That type of film study is a forte of former NFL player and executive Louis Riddick and NFL Films producer Greg Cosell, whose work is featured here alongside host Sal Paolantonio.

programme.title: Jimmy Houston Outdoors
programme.desc: Jimmy Houston takes viewers across the Americas and worldwide, fishing with great guests and offering entertainment alongside insightful instruction, as only Jimmy can do.

programme.title: Scott Martin Challenge
programme.desc: Scott Martin and Chris Zaldain take on one another in a classic SMC beatdown!

programme.title: NFL Matchup
programme.desc: An NFL Films production, "NFL Matchup" is definitely a show for football junkies. Unlike traditional football preview programs, this one gives fans an in-depth look at some of Sunday's games by breaking down the strategy and tactics -- the Xs and Os -- through the exclusive use of team-supplied footage. That type of film study is a forte of former NFL player and executive Louis Riddick and NFL Films producer Greg Cosell, whose work is featured here alongside host Sal Paolantonio.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The documentary series focuses on notable sports happenings.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 16 Tigers (11-2, 1-1 ACC) regroup as they host the No. 8 Tar Heels (10-3, 2-0). Clemson dropped its first conference game Jan. 3, 95-82 against Miami. RJ Davis scored 17 points in North Carolina's 91-71 victory over Clemson last season.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Streaking sides in the No. 25 Tigers (11-2) and Razorbacks (9-4) begin their SEC campaigns. Auburn rides a six-game win streak. Arkansas has won three straight. Tigers 6-foot-10 junior Johni Broome averages 15.8 points and 8.7 rebounds per contest.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Yellow Jackets (8-5, 1-1 ACC) seek to halt a two-game slide as they host the Eagles (9-4, 0-2). Miles Kelly scored 21 points in Georgia Tech's 73-65 triumph over Boston College last season, the Jackets' fifth straight in the head-to-head series.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Knights (9-3) get their first taste of Big 12 action when they visit the Wildcats (10-3). UCF has won three straight, but went 0-2 against Power Five schools during its non-conference slate. Kansas State is 2-0 all-time against UCF.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: A pair of 11-2 Lone Star State schools in the No. 20 Longhorns and Red Raiders clash in a Big 12 opener. Texas Tech claimed three of the last four meetings with Texas over the past two seasons. Max Abmas leads the Longhorns with 17.2 points per game.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 12 Cougars (12-1) and Bearcats (11-2) begin life in the Big 12. The schools have only met on the hardwood three times before, with BYU winning in 1931 and 1971, and Cincinnati triumphing in the first round of the 2001 NCAA Tournament.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The documentary series focuses on notable sports happenings.

programme.title: We're #1! The Story of 1999 Florida State Football
programme.desc: A look at the Seminoles' undefeated BCS National Championship team that went wire-to-wire as college football's No. 1 team during the 1999 season.

programme.title: UFC 290: Volkanovski vs. Rodriguez
programme.desc: Jalin Turner vs. Dan Hooker, lightweight; Robert Whitaker vs. Dricus Du Plessis, middleweight; Brandon Moreno vs. Alexandre Pantoja, flyweight title; Alexander Volkanovski vs. Yair Rodriguez, featherweight title. From T-Mobile Arena in Las Vegas.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: Filmmaker Billy Corben documents the rise to prominence of the college football program at the University of Miami.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The University of Miami's football program tries to recover from the devastation left by NCAA sanctions and scandals.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: Fantasy Football Now
programme.desc: "Fantasy Football Now" airs live on Sunday mornings during the NFL season, a time when fans are making last-minute roster moves and need the latest news from around the league. Providing the latest info are host Field Yates, analysts Mike Clay and Damien Woody, and senior writer and injury analyst Stephania Bell. Also contributing to the show are ESPN's NFL reporters, who bring fantasy players the latest intel from game sites and, in many cases, straight from the coach's mouth to give fantasy owners everything they need to know to set their lineups.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Flyers (11-2, 1-0) vie for their eighth straight victory over the Minutemen (10-3, 1-0) in an Atlantic 10 game. The teams won their conference openers by double-digits. Dayton's DaRon Holmes II averages 17.7 points and seven rebounds per contest.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Bruins (9-5, 2-1 MVC) try to topple the Bulldogs (12-2, 3-0) in this conference contest. Drake bested Belmont in both meetings last season. Waukee, Iowa, native Tucker DeVries leads the Bulldogs with 19.2 points and 3.6 assists per game.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The Tar Heels visit freshman phenom Hannah Hidalgo and the No. 16 Fighting Irish for an ACC affair. Notre Dame has won all five meetings in South Bend, Ind. North Carolina beat Notre Dame 60-50 last season behind 16 points by guard Paulina Paris.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The documentary series focuses on notable sports happenings.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Beterbiev vs. Smith: A Tale of Ten Punches
programme.desc: Dissecting the punches that ended the Artur Beterbiev and Joe Smith Jr. fight.

programme.title: ESPN Deportes 20 Years: Witnesses
programme.desc: ESPN Deportes celebrates 20 years by showcasing the most outstanding stories from the world of sports. Huge personalities that we saw strive, excel, break records, and achieve glory. Unforgettable moments from ESPN Deportes in the last 20 seasons.

Path to the College Football Playoff
30 for 30
programme.desc: The documentary series focuses on notable sports happenings.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Start the day off right with Chris Canty, Evan Cohen and Michelle Smallmon providing an energizing and informative way to take on the day. Sports, life and laughter are what it's all about.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: In-depth, comprehensive daily coverage of all aspects of the NBA from expert analysts.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: ESPN Sports Betting Analysts Erin Dolan and Joe Fortenbaugh, along with host Tyler Fulghum, break down the biggest storylines through the lens of sports betting, with breakdowns, discussions and picks.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 4 Huskies (12-2, 2-1 Big East) seek a third straight win as they visit the Bulldogs (10-4, 1-2). UConn is a perfect 7-0 all-time against Butler, but the Huskies are 0-2 on the road this season with losses to then-No. 5 Kansas and Seton Hall.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: A marquee Big Ten matchup pits No. 9 Illinois against No. 1 Purdue. In 2022-23, the Boilermakers won the lone meeting with the Fighting Illini 76-71. Purdue enters this match winners of six straight, while Illinois has won its past four.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Spartans aim for more success against the Broncos in this Mountain West Conference clash. Last season, San Jose State earned just its fourth win in 42 tries against Boise State as Garrett Anderson's 13 points helped seal a 74-68 overtime victory.

programme.title: Breaking The Huddle
programme.desc: Joel Klatt breaks down the top storylines in college football each week, including ranking his top 10 teams in the country, answer the internet's top college football questions, and more.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Gossip and exclusive stories about athletes' personal lives.

programme.title: TMZ Sports Weekend
programme.desc: Our news team constantly breaks exclusive stories featuring the biggest stars in sports.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: A marquee Big Ten matchup pits No. 9 Illinois against No. 1 Purdue. In 2022-23, the Boilermakers won the lone meeting with the Fighting Illini 76-71. Purdue enters this match winners of six straight, while Illinois has won its past four.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 4 Huskies (12-2, 2-1 Big East) seek a third straight win as they visit the Bulldogs (10-4, 1-2). UConn is a perfect 7-0 all-time against Butler, but the Huskies are 0-2 on the road this season with losses to then-No. 5 Kansas and Seton Hall.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Spartans aim for more success against the Broncos in this Mountain West Conference clash. Last season, San Jose State earned just its fourth win in 42 tries against Boise State as Garrett Anderson's 13 points helped seal a 74-68 overtime victory.

programme.title: Bassmaster Review
programme.desc: The fourth stop of the 2023 Bassmaster Elite Series visits Santee Cooper Lakes in South Carolina, a place where big bass live and previous records have been broken.

programme.title: Bassmaster Review
programme.desc: The fifth stop of the 2023 Bassmaster Elite Series season headed to Lay Lake on the Coosa River, marking the first time ever for the Elites here.

programme.title: Breaking The Huddle
programme.desc: Joel Klatt breaks down the top storylines in college football each week, including ranking his top 10 teams in the country, answer the internet's top college football questions, and more.

programme.title: All Madden
programme.desc: A tribute to John Madden's groundbreaking career - centered largely on the time after his Hall of Fame coaching career ended.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Hoyas (7-7, 0-3) and Blue Demons (3-10, 0-2) try to get back on track in a Big East game. Georgetown has dropped three straight. DePaul comes off an 85-56 loss at No. 7 UConn. Georgetown snapped a three-game series slide 81-76 last season.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Big East action in the Cornhusker State sees the Bluejays host the Friars. The schools split the season series in each of the last four campaigns. Creighton's Ryan Kalkbrenner averaged 18 points and seven rebounds against Providence in 2022-23.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The No. 21 Bluejays (10-3, 1-2 Big East) try to rebound against the Blue Demons (9-7, 1-2). Creighton comes off a 94-50 home loss versus No. 12 UConn on Jan. 3. Creighton has won four of the last five meetings with DePaul, including both last season.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: The Friars (8-7, 2-0) try to stay perfect in Big East play when they host the Red Storm (8-7, 2-1). St. John's took both meetings last season. Junior forward Olivia Olsen is averaging 14.6 points, 8.6 rebounds and two blocks per game for Providence.

programme.title: WWE Friday Night SmackDown
programme.desc: Randy Orton faces AJ Styles and LA Knight in a Triple Threat Match with the winner challenging WWE Undisputed Universal Champion Roman Reigns at the 2024 Royal Rumble.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Big East action in the Cornhusker State sees the Bluejays host the Friars. The schools split the season series in each of the last four campaigns. Creighton's Ryan Kalkbrenner averaged 18 points and seven rebounds against Providence in 2022-23.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Joel Soriano and the Red Storm venture to Villanova, Pa., to play the Wildcats in a Big East game. Villanova has won six straight meetings, and eight of the last nine. Soriano, a 6-foot-11 senior, averages 17.1 points and 10.4 rebounds per contest.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: The Buckeyes cross the state line for a Big Ten date against the Hoosiers. Malik Reneau scored 15 points as Indiana took the lone 2022-23 meeting from Ohio State 86-70, but the Buckeyes are still 7-3 against the Hoosiers in the last six seasons.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Red Raiders play host to the No. 13 Ducks. Oregon's offense set the modern school record for points scored in a game during an 81-7 rout of Portland State on Sept. 2. Texas Tech dropped its season opener versus Wyoming in double overtime.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 8 Trojans try to stay perfect against the Buffaloes. USC has won all 16 meetings, averaging 39.9 points in 11 Pac-12 get-togethers. Colorado comes off its first loss in the Deion Sanders era, a 42-6 shellacking at then-No. 10 Oregon.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 3 Wolverines (9-0, 6-0 Big Ten) visit the No. 10 Nittany Lions (8-1, 5-1). Michigan has defeated its opponents, all unranked, by an average margin of 34 points. Penn State moved up a spot in the CFP rankings following a win at Maryland.

programme.title: Breaking The Huddle
programme.desc: Joel Klatt breaks down the top storylines in college football each week, including ranking his top 10 teams in the country, answer the internet's top college football questions, and more.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Wolverines and Buckeyes square off as 11-0 teams for the second straight season. A Big Ten championship game berth and an all-but-certain spot in the College Football Playoff await the winner. Michigan won the last two meetings.
